column4: I just installed ubuntu 9.04 on a seperate partition from windows 7 which was already on the computer but grub wont recognize and let me boot into windows 7
can you see the windows partition from Ubuntu?
where would i go to check that?
look under places I believe
was Windows installed first and then you installed Ubuntu?
and grub does come up to load Ubuntu?
yes i choose from ubuntu and ubuntu recovery mode and an unidentified operating system i think its called
ok, use pastebin to give us the output of sudo fdisk -l and cat /boot/grub/menu.lst
i put sudo fdisk -l and cat /boot/grub/menu.lst into terminal? i did that and it just asked for password and did nothing
did you put the password in and hit enter? you won't see it do anything until you hit enter
are you using a lowercase L or the number after after fdisk?
sorry, meant the number 1?
i Copied and pasted what u typed, this   sudo fdisk -l and cat /boot/grub/menu.lst
you need to do them as seperate commands
so first do sudo fdisk -l , wait for the results then do cat /boot/grub/menu.lst
heres the link http://pastebin.ca/1483428
I *think* where it says rootnoverify    (hd0,0) it should be 0,2 as grub starts at 0,0 for the first disk first partition and I'm guessing Windows is at sda2
i dunno what sda2 is but i think sad6 is windows 7
ok, try 0,4 in the grub menu and see if Windows will boot
gksudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst
no problem, hopefully it works
